intro: Hieracium lorentzianum, commonly known as the Lorentz's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
